intro: Leucheria lanigera, commonly known as the woolly leucheria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Leucheria lanigera is often found in humid, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appearance.
